The Michael (Mechel) Langsam of Grybow, Poland Family


Some background email from the family can be found here.

Michael Langsam (20 May 1866 - 22 Mar 1932) was born in Grybow, Poland to Leopold Langsam and Fannie Haber. This detail comes from his 1904 US Passport Application and 1932 Death Certificate, both in his hometown of Lorain, OH. He married Bertha Neumann on 30 Jun 1899 in Cuyahoga County, Ohio and they had three known children. Nothing is known about Michael's siblings or how he connects to the overall Langsam tree, but there are two hints. Sailing aboard the Pretoria out of the port of Hamburg was a Feige Langsam, age 18, from Stroze, Poland (which is 3.5 miles from Grybow). She arrived in NYC on 1 December 1906 and listed her final destination as her uncle Mechele Langsam in Lorain, OH. No other detail can be found about her (the recorded age of 18 makes it unlikely that she was actually Fannie, the daughter of Michael, rather than his niece). The second hint also comes from the town of Stroze, Poland. Jacob Aron Langsam left Bremen, Germany and arrived at Ellis Island aboard the Main on 29 May 1906. He also come from Stroze, was married and 42 years old. His occupation was dealer and his final destination was a brother, Moche Langsam living at 46 Bayard, Brooklyn NY. The Brooklyn City directories list a Morris Langsam in 1906 at 144 Bayard, Brooklyn. In the 1905 NY Census Morris Langsam, age 36, b. Hungary was living at 142 Bayard St. His family is listed on Bayard in 1910 as well. This Morris Langsam family is listed as H58 in the Langsam-Spira Book. No other reference to Jacob Aron Langsam is found in US vital records. Perhaps the grandparent of Morris/Jacob Aron was a sibling to Leopold (father of Michael).

  • Fannie (23 Jun 1890 - 4 Dec 1969) was born in Lorain, Ohio. She married Morris Eisner and they had 3 children.
    • Leonard (28 May 1913 - 26 Oct 1990) married Virginia T.
      no other detail is known at this time
    • Lucille (20 Mar 1917 - 31 Oct 1983) was never married and passed away in Kirtland, Ohio, at a Long-Term Care facility.
    • Genevieve (17 Aug 1924 – 15 Jan 2015) married on 16 Dec 1951 in Cleveland, OH to Emanuel Mannie Elliott (1919 – 1997). Prior to their divorce in 1978 they had 3 children. Genevieve was originally in South Euclid and later in Charlotte, NC, and Maitland, FL. She was self-employed as an electrologist, both in Lyndhurst and Charlotte. Her infant daughter, Barbara, predeceased her.
      Barbara, David (Austin, TX) & Marci, (Orlando, FL)
  • Isaac "Ike" (14 Nov 1891 - 23 Jun 1981) grew up in Lorain, Ohio. During WWI he was in the US Army as a corporal in the field artillery regiment. He was married to Anna (daughter of Jacob Berkowitz and Rose Balitzer) on 4 Sep 1921 in Cuyahoga County, Ohio. They and had one known son, as per 1930 and 1940 census detail. Isaac passed away in Los Angeles, CA.
    • Jerome Herbert Langsam (13 Apr 1924 – 2011) was born in Cleveland, Ohio. He married Marge (26 Sep 1924 [Cleveland Heights, Ohio] - 18 Sep 2005), daughter of Phillip Miller & Dora Marcusson. There is a webpage that mentions Margery M. Langsam's second-grade class at Castlebay Lane School, Northridge. They had three known children.
      Jeffrey Philip, Kim Mccracken & Carrie Ann
  • Charles Benjamin (20 Aug 1898 - 22 Mar 1932) was born in Lorain, OH. He was a doctor married to Sylvia D Flexer in Philadelphia, PA in 1925. Dr. Langsam passed away from pneumonia in Lima, Ohio at Mt. Sinai hospital at 1:40 am. His wife remarried to Irving Warren and they raised Judith.
    • Judith I (1932 - 2002) was born a few weeks before her father passed away, on 12 Feb 1932. She was married to Arthur L. Stone. They relocated to Brooklyn, NY. Later in life she lived in Vermont where her daughter Sylvy Elliott lived.
      Maura, Matthew & Sylvy E Stone
